news_header: President Trump has reiterated the idea of Canada becoming the 51st state, linking it to Canada's natural resources. He announced 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum imports, including from Canada, citing military protection costs.
news_original_title: Trump Doubles Down on &quot;51st State&quot; Talk, Enacts Tariffs on Steel and Aluminum
news_text: Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau acknowledged Trump's intentions, suggesting a real concern over economic domination. This has escalated trade tensions, reminiscent of the 2018 trade war. Trump's tariffs are tied to border security and the fentanyl crisis, while Canada is advancing its critical minerals industry amidst these tensions.
